intro: Linosyris hastata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved linosyris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Linosyris hastata typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open grasslands and along streambanks. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
